(54) 321.It is my clear understanding of our discussions before the susrAmcr 3*ecossthat my colleagues agreed that the Overseas Information Services should be exempted from the economies which Lord Swinton's Committee was considering. .2. I cannot see that any useful purpose would be served by a furtherMinisterial Committee investigating this problem. It has already been thesubject of three different investigations, including one by Ministers.All these enquiries have endorsed the need for expanding our information services.' - .3. I can only repeat that the efficient conduct of our foreign policyrequires the expansions recommended by the Drogheda Committee. recent developments in the foreign field reinforce this need. I must therefore ask my colleagues for an urgent decision on this matter which has now beenoutstanding for well over a year and must renew my recommendation thatthe proposals of the Home Secretary's Committee should be accepted without further delay.A.E.Foreign Office, S.W.1.27th October, 1954.COPY NO.
